quest.name: Fear of the Dark
journal: Gaia appears to be conversing with the voice inside her head.

You and Ryne can only look on in worry as Gaia is overcome by another assault on her senses caused by the voice in her head. Thankfully, this troubling episode ends as suddenly as it began, though she is left with the lingering notion of using Darkness to restore the Empty. Ryne soon realizes that this may indeed provide a means by which to revitalize the withered flora. It seems that the Light's influence on the ambient aether is still too strong to allow life to flourish, and shifting the alignment closer to Darkness should redress the balance. The three of you make your way to Eden's core to put your theories to the test.

In order to restore balance to the aether, you must call upon the image of an entity embodying Darkness. As you have no experience fighting primals of that nature, your memories of the Cloud of Darkness, ruler among voidsent, will instead form the basis for the summoning.

※Eden's Promise: Umbra can be accessed via the Duty Finder.

With Ryne and Gaia working in harmony to manipulate the ambient aether, the plan to call forth a likeness of the Cloud of Darkness is a success. Naturally, you rise to the occasion and slay the beast, returning its aether to the Empty. Gaia is keen to return to the camp to observe whether your efforts have yielded the desired results.

Much to your dismay, the once-verdant foliage is no closer to being rejuvenated. However, the strangely shifting hues of the crystal that towers above indicate that something has changed...be it for good or ill.
objectives: Speak with Ryne in Eden's core.

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: It's been so long since Gaia had one of her headaches that I thought the faerie might've disappeared for good. Do you think it's got something to do with Eden?

dialogue.name: GAIA
dialogue.text: Restore...Darkness...

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: What did you say, Gaia?

dialogue.name: GAIA
dialogue.text: Restore the Darkness...to the world flooded by Light...

dialogue.name: GAIA
dialogue.text: Ah! That's it!

dialogue.name: GAIA
dialogue.text: We thought we'd restored balance to the six elements, but perhaps they're still too strongly aligned with Light? If that's the case, maybe we can set things right by using Darkness.

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: By using Darkness? Are...are you serious!?

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: But hold on... It might actually work!

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: Gaia, that's a brilliant idea!

dialogue.name: GAIA
dialogue.text: I-I wouldn't go that far. I just remembered what I learned during our adventures, that's all.

dialogue.name: GAIA
dialogue.text: But this does mean we'll need to call on your services again, if that's all right with you?

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: We've come this far together, and we'll see our mission to the end! To Eden's core!

dialogue.name: GAIA
dialogue.text: I'll say one thing before we start: if this all goes horribly wrong, don't even think about pinning it on me! Not that it will, of course...

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: Right, let's get started!

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: But...hmmm... Were there any primals aligned with Darkness? I can't seem to recall any...

dialogue.name: GAIA
dialogue.text: You mean there isn't one?

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: The Ascians' god, Zodiark, may be suitable, but we need something that Forename has actually encountered─and preferably defeated.

dialogue.name: GAIA
dialogue.text: Well, does it have to be a primal for it to work? If it's just a lot of Darkness that we need, perhaps there are other ways to get it.

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: You may be right! What we ultimately need is a state of highly charged Darkness─it shouldn't matter what form it takes. Does anything come to mind, Forename?

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: I daresay the Flood of Darkness had a fair bit of...Darkness.

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: I know a few voidsent that would fit the bill.

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: You mean the catastrophe that swallowed the Thirteenth and turned it into a lifeless void? Erm, we might need something on a slightly smaller scale...

dialogue.name: GAIA
dialogue.text: The creatures I unleashed while under the faerie's control... If we were able to summon one powerful enough, it just might work.

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: The Cloud of Darkness... I can't begin to imagine how powerful it must have been.

dialogue.name: GAIA
dialogue.text: I'd say we've found the perfect candidate.

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: But where to find a suitable place, one where Darkness is strong... It won't be easy in a world flooded by Light.

dialogue.name: GAIA
dialogue.text: Well, we've got the Warrior of Darkness and the Oracle of Darkness right here. It seems like a good enough spot to me.

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: But what about the Light-aligned aether that's all around us?

dialogue.name: GAIA
dialogue.text: That's where you come in. You can suppress the Light while I draw out the Darkness. By combining our powers, we can make it work wherever we are.

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: Combining our powers...

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: Yes, between us, there's nothing we can't achieve! Don't be afraid, Gaia!

dialogue.name: GAIA
dialogue.text: I'm not afraid─just very concerned that this will all go horribly wrong...which is the same thing, I suppose. Anyway, it's certainly not easy coming up with these plans by ourselves.

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: That's true. But when this is over, we can reward ourselves with all sorts of delicious treats at the festival!

dialogue.name: GAIA
dialogue.text: Festival? What do you mean?

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: We spoke about it on the way here, remember? I asked if you wanted to take part.

dialogue.name: GAIA
dialogue.text: Um... I was busy piloting the skyslipper, so I probably wasn't paying attention.

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: Oh well, not to worry. We can talk about that later. Right now we've got a job to do!

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: I'll draw out the ambient aether...

dialogue.name: GAIA
dialogue.text: And I'll shift its alignment to Darkness!

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: Now, Forename! Focus your thoughts!

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Memories of the Cloud of Darkness enshroud your mind...

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: This is the first time we've tried this since that disaster with Shiva, so I'd be lying if I said I wasn't nervous. Even so, I can't afford to waver now!

dialogue.name: GAIA
dialogue.text: I've called forth real voidsent before─so everyone tells me, anyway─but this is unknown territory for me. With the two of you by my side, though, I'm sure it'll work!

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: So that was what a world flooded by Darkness would look like...

dialogue.name: GAIA
dialogue.text: That all went surprisingly well. Of course, we have Forename to thank for slaying that ghastly creature.

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: You were fantastic, Gaia! Anyone would think you're an old hand at this!

dialogue.name: GAIA
dialogue.text: You weren't so bad yourself. We make quite a team, don't we?

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: We certainly do!

dialogue.name: GAIA
dialogue.text: I don't know about you two, but I'm itching to see whether our hard work has paid off. Let's head back.

dialogue.name: GAIA
dialogue.text: Hmm... The plants are just as lifeless as they were before. Maybe the Light's influence is still too strong?

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: What in the world...?

dialogue.name: GAIA
dialogue.text:
In fleeting hues and endless warmth,
A gentle light washed over me.

dialogue.name: GAIA
dialogue.text: A glimmer of hope once lost...
